me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit

Class TextCycler

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.TextCycler

  • public final class TextCycler
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which rotates through text to keep it within a specific length limit.
    Author:
    Glen Husman

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextCycler

        public TextCycler(java.lang.String text,
          int trimLength)
        Creates a text cycler with the given text.
        Parameters:
        text - The untrimmed text of the cycler.
        trimLength - The length of the trimmed text.

      • TextCycler

        public TextCycler(java.lang.String prefix,
          java.lang.String text,
          int trimLength)
        Creates a text cycler with the given text and an uncycled prefix.

        Note that the text cycler does not automatically append spacing to the body text string. The caller may wish to do so, such as via a call to StringUtils.leftPad(String, int). If this is called with the desired pad length on the input string, the padding affect will occur.

        Parameters:
        prefix - The constant prefix of the text.
        text - The untrimmed text of the cycler.
        trimLength - The length of the trimmed text.

    • Method Detail

      • getTrimLength

        public int getTrimLength()
        Gets the length to which text is trimmed by this cycler.
        Returns:
        The trim length of this text cycler instance.

      • getPrefix

        public java.lang.String getPrefix()
        Gets the untrimmed constant prefix to the text in this cycler.
        Returns:
        A non-null string representing the prefix to the cycled text.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Gets the untrimmed text in this cycler which is cycled.
        Returns:
        A non-null string representing the original text.

      • tick

        public java.lang.String tick()
        Ticks the text cycler, incrementing the start position of the text.
        Returns:
        The old value of the text cycler, including the prefix. This value can also be retrieved by the appropriate methods, however its computation is not cached.
